reviews.review_text: again I'm unhappy with the way things are done in the produce department these brussel sprouts are going bad they've got a lot of black mold and mildew on them they should be fresh and they should not be kept so wet that's the problem I'm going to have to return or get my money back I can probably salvage some of them but there are a lot of prep work anyway and they're way too expensive I know Walmart can do better with this thanks

reviews.title: Produce leaves something to be desired
reviews.review_text: These were picked up same day as ordered and I went to cook them that same day. These were pitiful! All brown on the outside. I was able to shred them and use about 1/3 of the total as I had planned them for dinner. If these were the best to offer, I would prefer my shopper say there were none available than receive these.

reviews.title: AWFUL
reviews.review_text: Every time I buy these Brussels they‚Äôre ALWAYS dirty and filled with black/brown spots. Even when I cut them the same day as my pickup order. I end up throwing half of them away everytime. I will not purchase these again. And Walmart makes you bring them all the way back to the store in order to get a refund. Ridiculous!!

reviews.title: Shameful
reviews.review_text: Whosoever went to do my shopping, what did you give me? Would you not purchase that for yourself and your family? I cried when I saw this trash! Who is even monitoring the store and these produce to ensure you are not making people sick? Shameful, and I want a refund!

reviews.title: Full of Bug/Burrow Holes
reviews.review_text: Please change vendor. I love brussel sprouts and without fail I may find about 7 out of the bag that aren't completely destroyed by some kind of bug that is burrowing through and aome bags you can tell by looking at them but for the most part you cant. i literally had a small worm pop out of one bag. How is this okay? If you think asking for a refund will work they will have you bring it back... I'm using pickup service for a reason and driving back to the store is not convenient. Walmart needs to allow a photo as proof as an alternative. Change vendors these have been horrible for a hor minute now! Shameful.

reviews.title: Brussel sprouts were black
reviews.review_text: When I took both of the brussel sprout bags out of my Walmart bag they were soggy and had black spots all over them. Both bags of Brussel sprouts were like this. I unloaded my produce and all groceries as soon as I got home. I wish I hadn‚Äôt wasted the money on them. I had to throw them away.

only reason this product got a star is that zero isnt an option, these Brussels were not only tiny but half of them were already rotten when they arrived the other half were infested with bugs so deep in the Brussels there was no hope of salvaging them you would have had to remove every single leaf and wash them in order to clean off all the pests

reviews.title: Do a better job
reviews.review_text: We love Brussels Sprouts‚Ä¶ Have ordered several times‚Ä¶ They always give us sprouts that have dark spots and I have to cut most of the sprouts away‚Ä¶ One time they were so bad, the curb delivery person thought they were so bad, he went in and got us a fresh bag‚Ä¶ The ‚Äúpickers‚Äù need to do a better job selecting produce‚Ä¶

reviews.title: Worms inside Brussels sprouts
reviews.review_text: We could not eat them because all the Brussel sprouts had worms in them. I inspected all of them in both bags and they were both full of worms inside.

reviews.title: Not very fresh. Very small.
reviews.review_text: We love eating roasted sprouts at our house. I've been buying these for a while now and it's been hit or miss. Lately they've gotten worse. Like others have said black wilted leaves. Just not very fresh. If I was shopping at the store I wouldn't buy them.. But I keep getting them delivered hoping they will improve. Not happening unfortunately. And the fact that they are very small to start with means by the time you trim the stalk and cut them in half, the dead leafs fall off, there's not much left.

reviews.title: Fresh but small.
reviews.review_text: I ordered these brussel sprouts for delivery. They arrived pretty fresh, but were small. You have to peel off the top few leaves to get to the fresh part, and after you do that, not a lot is left. Considering that, you might as well buy the bigger, more expensive brands.

reviews.title: Very, very, Very dissatisfied customer!
reviews.review_text: I ordered, As you can see, one bag of Brussels sprouts and you sent bag of LIMES!! We are not having good luck today are we????! Plus, the banana you sent is brown and way too ripe with one end open, (not eatable) , one avocado that has a big and deep dent in one side of it, (I'm sure it's not completely eatable) and await instructions on what to do with these three items. AND, you charged me for all. What am I going to do with 18 oz of limes?! I'd like for you to pick up all items and be credited for them all.

reviews.title: Wilted and brown spots
reviews.review_text: I agree with most of the reviewers. These brussel sprouts were not the freshest. There were brown spots and wilted leaves on a lot of the vegetables. This is the downside of grocery delivery. It would be nice if the employee picking the produce would pick the more fresh looking produce.

The brusell sprouts were slightly sloggy when they arrived. They were rubbery. After peeling back several dead layers, there was not much less. in the end, I threw them in the garbage the day they were delivered. there were other issues with all the vegetables in that order. I had a similar experience in a prior grocery order. if i had picked them out myself while in store (not delivery), I probably could have picked a better fresh batch, and I might have been able to enjoy them.

reviews.title: Disappointed again
reviews.review_text: It's not the products fault. I blame management %26 Sparks drivers . Only because I tried to return it to the store it was delivered from. And was unable to because they cannot do refunds for online orders at the store. So I decided to shop and replace the brussels sprouts. Totally disappointing! They looked exactly like the ones that were delivered to me earlier that day. Disgusting, slimy,rotten, and smelly. I looked at the hole refrigerated produce department and the whole section was frozen. All the heads of lettuce all the bags of vegetables and salad bags brussels sprouts and fresh vegetables , FROZEN!!! Walmart should really have OGP handpick all online delivery orders. Because sparks drivers are jokes. A lot of them speak limited English and show little care. BTW‚Ä¶ this was a re-order to replace items ordered from a different store. That gave me brussels sprouts in the same condition. Walmart Produce section needs work ASAP.

I I went to the wrong store. Blake, at Denison was super sweet. Helped me decide to go on to Sherman. Then I went to Sherman and Jay was calling me from there checking on me. I got there soon and he came right out. I hope I remembered his name. He was sooo sweet.

reviews.title: The Brussels Sprouts are a lie.
reviews.review_text: I would absolutely love this item had they delivered it instead of an ARTICHOKE. They didn't substitute it. They straight delivered an artichoke instead of the brussels sprouts. Absolute genius shopping there, bud.

reviews.title: Disgusting Brussels Sprouts -Change Vendors Please
reviews.review_text: Over the past six months I have received the grossest of the gross of these brussels sprouts. The brand is Church Brothers and I am going to put a complaint in with them. It has been very disappointing that your Walmart shoppers continue to give them to online orderers who are not picking the produce themselves and I would've hoped your produce manager would have switched vendors by now noting how they have had black worms and gross mold or worm poop in almost every bag! It's disgusting!!

reviews.title: Rotten produce received
reviews.review_text: I received a bag of rotten Brussels sprouts in my order. I attempted to wash and try to salvage by peeling the black layer off, however that was not possible. They were slimy and also many of them also have a foul order. I would‚Äôve returned had I not removed original packaging and attempted to wash and salvage. In the future, I would rather get nothing than an item that‚Äôs inedible.

reviews.title: Rottening Brussel Sprouts... NOT GOOD!
reviews.review_text: This item came looking likebit had been sitting for years. I definitly. woild not have gotten these. brussel sprouts looking likr they are looking...OLD, SCARED, and DARKENING. I think they may have been a subsitute... I would have NEVER gotten this for my self or anyone else. Really doesn't deserve 1 star. B.

reviews.title: fresh is nicer
reviews.review_text: I have discovered that if I cut these thin with the food processor put in acovered bowl with a bit of butter, they come out sweetly tender. Family is asking for them weekly now. Cooking that way reduces the strong flavor. This works only with fresh sprouts.

reviews.title: always hit and miss
reviews.review_text: about 25% of them were moldy inside this time. Not enough for me to ask for a refund, but enough that I wont be ordering these for awhile. I put them in the fridge as soon as they arrived and cut them the next day.

reviews.title: Disgusting
reviews.review_text: We're bad when I received the item. I cut them the same day I got my groceries and they were yellow and black. When I cut them open they were full of bad spots and black spots/bugs.

reviews.title: Rotton Brussels sprouts
reviews.review_text: Would be refreshing if the person(s) filling the order would select items as though they were buying for themselves. More often than not, fresh produce is less than desoreable. Rotton, slimey Brussels sprouts.

reviews.title: Utter disgrace
reviews.review_text: I'm disabled and need to use this option. Whomever is shopping has never been in a grocery store. This is what I pull out the bag‚Ä¶tried calling but ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù tells me to bring in ü§Ø so very disappointed
This item is in really bad conditions, to me it means that Wal-Mart didn't sell fresh vegetables and won't pay attention in vegetables that are in bad conditions.
This order was so screwed up!!!! It was supposed to be brussels sprouts and I ended up with a bag of limes! Half the items didn't even come, shabby, shabby, shabby crap

reviews.title: "OLD"
reviews.review_text: The were old and should never have been on the shelf, shame on the ones that work that department, you are getting paid for not doing your job. Will not buy again. Your competitor does a much better job.

reviews.title: Old vegetables
reviews.review_text: These things should have been thrown away instead of given to a customer. This is why soo many people don't do pick up. Why do pick up when I have to come back to the store and bring it back. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

reviews.title: bad brussels, brother
reviews.review_text: these brussels sprouts are barely even edible. most of them are rotten. I probably used one full bag out of the three i bought. I don't know why I've had to learn this lesson several times, but don't buy produce from Walmart.

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review_text: This online pickup order (%232000136-88234434) was placed Sep 4, 2025, 5:55‚ÄØAM (3 days ago) and shopped in-house. It was picked up on Sep 04, 2025 at 10:22am. This is the third instance of my getting poor quality brussels sprouts.

reviews.title: Inedible
reviews.review_text: The bag was slimey with rot and bugs, this is a big reason I don't get veggies from y'all. The fact someone thought it was appropriate to sell it like boggles my mind, if it wasn't for how much gas is I would of bought it back.

reviews.title: bad produce
reviews.review_text: i think i must have recieved these brussell sprouts before they are thrown away. they are brown look wilted some ready for trash. very disappointed with walmarts produce again....

reviews.title: Bug holes running through every one
reviews.review_text: I will not be buying brussel sprouts at Walmart again. the last few times the Sprouts head bug holes deeply into the vegetable. These are more fit for Hogs or chickens than humans.

reviews.title: Horrid quality
reviews.review_text: I used curbside delivery. I purchased two of the Brussels Sprouts and about 1/2 of them were bad when I was prepping them. Very strong odor and strong flavor. Actually the worst I've had.

reviews.title: VERY Infested with worms
reviews.review_text: These are so bad i'm swearing them off, never buying brussel sprouts from Walmart again. i have had problems before with them being wormy and having to throw some away. but this last batch, I bought 3 1lb bags and had to throw most of them away, so many of them were completely infested and eaten by these little green worms. There aren't JUST worms and holes but also rotten/ dirty areas full of what I can only assume are the worms secretions and maybe even tiny little eggs. I probably had maybe 1 lb left that was edible of the 3 bags and that's with cutting through them meticulously trying to salvage what I could. Absolutely NOT WORTH IT with how expensive these are!! the photos are what MOST of them looked like.

reviews.title: Usually very Good
reviews.review_text: This has been a bad month of produce shopping. We prefer FRESH over frozen. These Brussels sprouts are in very bad shape. They've always have been fresh and a vibrant green in the past. Recently, it has not been. The bag looked green, but it was rotted. Same with a second bag and the third bag the leaves are yellow and dark spot. This is a sign.That brussels sprouts are not fresh. They start getting bitter. I figured once OK but now three times. Walmart has been very good about refunding the affected produce. I'd really like to have fresh produce that hasn't been stored in the back for a long time.

reviews.title: Russel sprouts
reviews.review_text: Very bad they are black and spoiled I end up throwing them in the trash. I usually not complain about stuffs I bought at Walmart but this could cause my family to get sick.

reviews.title: Why, just, WHY?
reviews.review_text: if I could give zero stars I would. They were shriveled and brown, expired. Don't know why someone would think they should send them out. Wal Mart did issue me a refund though.

reviews.title: Nice and fresh
reviews.review_text: These were nice and large and fresh this time. Sometimes I get them in there the size of your thumb sometimes I get rid of the size of your toe so there's no consistency. The bigger ones are a little bit better though.

reviews.title: Brussel Fugus!!!
reviews.review_text: I thought that ordering fresh meant exactly that. Moldy vegetables aren't my idea of fresh and should hav3 been thrown out days ago. This produce should have never made it out of thr store as a purchased item. The items are brown, soft, and unsavable. Refund requested immediately, please.

reviews.title: Poor quality produce
reviews.review_text: Brussels sprouts: this is the poorest quality of sprouts I‚Äôve ever encountered. They are advertised as ‚Äúfresh‚Äù but they are ready for the bin. Your shoppers were billed to me as very particular with picking these items. That couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth. Re-train them to do better. I will request a refund for this purchase.

reviews.title: Shopper gave me bad vegetable
reviews.review_text: I did a grocery pick up for a quick outside pick up since i wasn‚Äôt feeling well. I ordered Brussel Sprouts as one of my items. If i wasn‚Äôt sick i would drive right back and return. Whoever shopped my cart i wonder if they shop for their family this way.

reviews.title: A little dry for fresh produce.
reviews.review_text: I cook Brussel sprouts about 8 times a year and these dried out. I bake as well steam them and these couldn‚Äôt be baked. I had to steam them and they were stringy and very little moisture. Product came from Mexico. Maybe they are having a drought in that area. I won‚Äôt be buying again. Grade C-

reviews.title: Infested
reviews.review_text: The Brussels sprouts have been having a lot of bug/worm residue in most of them for the last 3 times I've ordered them. They come from Dole. I think Walmart should contact Dole and let them know what poor quality these are. There were only 7 sprouts in the entire bag that weren't infested.

reviews.title: Rotten
reviews.review_text: Don't bother getting the Brussel sprouts if you do a pick up order bc they will be rotting at least 75% of the time. Whoever the shoppers are that are picking the orders must be blind and really WALMART shouldn't have rotting veggies in the produce section anyway. When I go inside myself to pick them out I can usually find a good bag of them.

reviews.title: Fresh, better than cabbage
reviews.review_text: I got a good batch from store pickers in North Las Vegas, NV. One pound fresh in a blue net bag, grown in Mexico, prebagged by Church Brown Farms in Calif., 500 miles away. There are 16 large, firm, dark green Brussels sprouts with tightly clinging outer leaves and are clean (bag reminds "wash before use"). They are best roasted but I steamed then sliced them, removing stem ends. Insides are as fresh, firm and clean as outside but lighter color. Made into a salad with quinoa, cashews, lemon juice, oil, and bit of cheese. These were excellent quality on 3/8/2024. Highly recommend this brand. And that you shop the day after your WMT restocks.

reviews.title: Why are these always ROTTEN? Shouldn‚Äôt be on shelf
reviews.review_text: Why do they always send me rotten brussel sprouts in my pickup order? 90% of the time they look like this. I am sick of taking the financial hit. They should not be on the shelf let alone sent to a pickup customer when you say ‚Äòfresh‚Äô items. These are inedible. Quit buying from Springfield Farms. They are so nasty all the time. Slimy and black on outside. Green Giant is usually better but not great either. Springfield is never not rotten and the majority of what our store carries in Omaha. YUCK! Even rotten inside as shown in last pic.

reviews.title: Recall Brussels Sprouts?
reviews.review_text: There's something seriously wrong with these Brussels Sprouts. About 1/5 of the purple net bundle had this deposit of ash like substance. It seemed biologic like maybe really tiny dead bugs??? I'm not sure but it was in between the leaves, deeper than just something that splashed in the rain. It didn't go all the way to the center. Consider a recall!
The brussels sprouts are great. But this is the third time I have ordered them and received tomatillos instead!!!

reviews.title: Disgusting!
reviews.review_text: Almost not edible. I should've returned them but I live too far for it to make sense. Never buying brussel sprouts from Walmart again!

reviews.title: simple and yummy
reviews.review_text: Rinse em in the net then steam them until fork tender . A little butter and a shaking of Parmesan cheese, mm good
I did not receive fresh Brussels sprouts. Instead, I received a bag of tomatillos. Those are not an appropriate substitute for Brussels sprouts.

reviews.title: Quality not the best.
reviews.review_text: Around a quarter of the bag suffered bug damage and/or heavily discolored deep patches that spoiled many pieces.

reviews.title: These BS were so big, tough, and bitter.
reviews.review_text: Brussels sprouts are best when they're.small. These were larger than golf balls. Very old like most of the food they sell.

reviews.title: Bad season to order
reviews.review_text: I received it this morning. They looked fine, just having some black dots outter leaves. But when I cut them, they are all bug damaged.

reviews.title: good for delivery
reviews.review_text: These are good for delivery because Brussels sprouts last and they are in a bag so they can't give you sketchy ones.
rotten brussel sprouts with literal worms in them and eggs all throughout‚Ä¶don't get brussel sprouts from here

reviews.title: Disgusting
reviews.review_text: Junk! Bought 2 bags of these Brussels sprouts the rabbit got to eat them because they ere infested with worms and bugs‚Ä¶ please feel free to refund my money.

reviews.title: Love
reviews.review_text: I love brussel sprouts and I tried cooking them. They were a little crunchy and my sister asked me how long I had cooked them. I said about a few minutes. She told me that I needed to cook fresh Brussels sprouts for 2 hours.
There were tiny worms or caterpillar larva in several of them. I couldn't really tell exactly what they were because they were small but it was gross.

reviews.title: I like what I like and I love big Brussels
reviews.review_text: I could not believe the size of these Brussels‚Ä¶ They are huge‚Ä¶ I love, brussels sprouts and Walmart selection of fresh vegetables are very fresh and tasty‚Ä¶ Don't pass up on these humongous brussels sprouts with great flavor!
i bought 2 lbs sprouts and they were completely rotten. Had to go to Martins and got really fresh ones. They should not have been put in my order
Black and moldy- horrible shopper before thanksgiving. Need to drive back to the store to return them-
The brussels sprouts looked like they've gone through world war two. I will limit the amount of fresh produce that I buy from walmart.

reviews.title: Online shopping
reviews.review_text: I love the ability to shop for groceries and pick them up when I have time to save time from shopping in store

reviews.title: Dead veggies
reviews.review_text: The Brussels Sprouts were old, dead and dried out. Why are they being sold? Please do better with your produce.

reviews.title: Disgusted
reviews.review_text: These Brussel sprouts were delivered rotten! I am going to ask for a refund. Somebody at Walmart needs to teach the shoppers how to pick out fresh produce. This is unforgivable!

reviews.title: Bugs
reviews.review_text: The day I bought these I went to wash and prepare them only to find multiple bugs inside. They looked like small caterpillars alive and eating through the brussel sprouts
there were many blackened layers and some parts that were cut off from the actual brussel sprouts. they didnt look edible to me. very poor quality. need to return them now.

reviews.title: Spoiled
reviews.review_text: Black and spotty all over. I had groceries delivered and multiple spoiled items but this is the only one that it was so obvious without having to open the bag.

reviews.title: nasty looking vegetables again
reviews.review_text: honestly cant tell how they can keep selling produce that looks lije this. the next time they ship this kind of crap to me i am going to drive it back to the store and see if this is what the stuff on the shelf looks like..

reviews.title: Rotten Brussels sprouts.
reviews.review_text: Product was rotten. I don‚Äôt see how the shopper could have missed the very bad condition of these Brussels sprouts. They were for my Christmas dinner. Now o will have to make a trip to Albertsons which is 18 miles away.
Brussel sprouts are old probably from before Thanksgiving. The leaves are yellow and brown and the bag his nasty water in it. Looks like they pulled it out of the trash!!!

reviews.title: These Brussels are sprouting with bugs
reviews.review_text: Bought a bag on July 10th. As soon as I cut into them I noticed black spots and holes. Carried on and found a bug. Have now checked half the bag and every single one has bugs in them. Throughly unstoked.

reviews.title: BUGS.
reviews.review_text: There were literal eggs and bugs crawling out of my brussel sprouts only 5 fays after picking them up. They only had a couple browning keaves on top. Absolutely disgusting.

reviews.title: Moldy
reviews.review_text: These were the most pitiful bag of brussels sprouts I've ever seen in my life. They are moldy, soft and beyond help. I'll be dropping them off at the service desk tomorrow. They smell bad and will be spending tje night in the garage.
ive ordered these twice and both time they were dried up - very old

reviews.title: Disgusting
reviews.review_text: These just arrived at my house and there was maggots coming out of them!
i ordered brussels sprouts and instead received tomatillos! where are my brussels sprouts???

reviews.review_text: Only got two tomatillos for $2.68 seems like the scale is messed up.

most of them were old and/or wormy. walmart delivery produce is sorely lacking in quality.

reviews.title: Mushy
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately the quality of these Brussel sprouts is lacking. They are consistently mushy ‚Äî ie not crisp or fresh.

reviews.title: Bugs.
reviews.review_text: Second bag back to back that was full of bugs. I know bugs eat plants, but it wasn't just one or two, there was a bunch. It's disgusting.

reviews.title: Great Brussel Sprouts
reviews.review_text: Great size, taste and crunchiness. We like roasting these on a sheet pan. They always turn out great!

I thought I had ordered frozen in sauce Brussels sprouts since I was in the frozen department and not fresh produce section. I‚Äôm seriously considering doing my shopping at Krogers again. This isn‚Äôt the first time Walmart employees have messed up my order.

reviews.review_text: This item is a disappointment. The picture misleads the customer. The package is very little and the quality is not good

reviews.title: Bad brussels sprouts.
reviews.review_text: Ordered for delivery and they were turning yellow slimy and smelled bad management should be ashamed to sell a product. It‚Äôs going bad.

reviews.title: Old brussel sprouts
reviews.review_text: Please have a discussion with your grocery pickers about not picking the wilted brown vegetables to send home with someone in their pickup order.

reviews.title: Fresh and of uniform size
reviews.review_text: These were easier to prepare because there were no extra small or large ones in the bag and they did not need much removal of outer leaves. Fresh.

reviews.title: WRONG BRUSSEL SPROUTS
reviews.review_text: For some reason the Brussel sprouts had water or something very damp all over them, plus some of the leaves are yellowish, and brownish. In a few days they will not be eatable.

reviews.title: Terrible Product
reviews.review_text: Terrible product!! They were rotten in a day! üëé
The driver delivered 2 heads if broccoli instead of the 2 bags of Brussel sprouts.
I did not receive Brussel Sprouts, I received Tomatillos Milpero 1lb instead.
I received 2 bags of tomatillos not Brussel sprouts.
Driver bought tomatillos instead of brussel sprouts
The Brussels that were delivered are not good. They are brown.

reviews.title: Moldy %26 slimy produce
reviews.review_text: Moldy. All of them had black slime %26 dots on them.
Received these through grocery pick up they were moldy!

reviews.title: Worms!
reviews.review_text: They had worms and a lot of rotten layers-couldn‚Äôt even salvage it
Purchased 2 bags, both were full of worms and little bugs

reviews.title: Wouldn't purchase online again
reviews.review_text: The size of the Brussels sprouts were smaller than grapes. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Poor quality, full of bugs
reviews.review_text: These were full of insect holes, obvious insect eggs and even larvae itself

reviews.title: fresh and yummy
reviews.review_text: have to wash thoroughly, but other than that it came out great

reviews.title: Moldy sprouts
reviews.review_text: Brussels sprout we're thrown out because they had mold or what looked like mold on them
Absolutely nasty slimy brussel sprouts. throwing them out. waste of money.

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.review_text: These are often wormy and have holes in them.

reviews.title: won't keep long unless frozen
reviews.review_text: put in freezer so wouldn't turn brown

reviews.title: Brussels Sprouts
reviews.review_text: Walmart is a great place to shop, my order is always on time and the product are fresh . But my problem today is the Brussels sprouts are no good and I am not able to take it back .what do I do ?

reviews.title: All rotten
reviews.review_text: I receive them on Saturday evening. By Monday night, when I was going to prepare them, they all were completely rotten. I had to throw them to the trash. Lesson learned: it‚Äôs better to by your vegetables yourself

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.review_text: Terrible quality! The stems are totally dried out like wood. And the actual Brussels sprouts are wilted and wimpy. These are inedible- I'm afraid to eat! Going into trash.

reviews.title: Way over ripe
reviews.review_text: These were over ripe when my husband picked them up. He said they were slimy. Here‚Äôs a picture 3 days later. He had to go to another store to get good ones. So I could make my corn beef.

reviews.title: DONT BUY!!! Tunnels from bugs outside %26 hiding
reviews.review_text: Full of tunnels and i had to throw out the whole bag. WILL never BUY these again. I might have been able to eat 2 out of the whole bag but it grossed me out knowing when I cut in half they had more holes.

reviews.title: full of bugs
reviews.review_text: The last time I purchased these, I ordered 2 bags. Both bags were unusable. After slicing all of them in half, we discovered about 75% of them had little bugs in them and we full of holes. we just through them out. Absolutely disgusting.

reviews.title: Bugs
reviews.review_text: I stopped buying these altogether, because they're full of worms/larva, bug eggs, and small dead insects every single time I buy them, no matter the season. So gross.

reviews.title: Rotten Brussels sprouts
reviews.review_text: I received the order the other day when I looked at the bag the Brussels looked dirty. I washed them but no dirt came off. When I cut them open they were rotten had to throw the bag away.
